channel.title: Help with hosting issue
channel.description: For some reason when I upgraded my internet speed from a static ip to a dhcp address, I can no longer host my server at my house. Sometimes my ip rarely changes from starting out at like 64 to 204 and if it does I can host again. Could anyone explain it thoroughly for me please and if there is still a way to host? Because I've tried everything I know of.

item.title: Help with hosting issue
item.dc:creator: @xneonx xneonx
item.description:
@xneonx wrote:

Fridder:

Your IP address changes or your IPv4 address changes? Davidi2 or someone made a tutorial on how to stop your IPv4 address from changing.

I believe my IPv4 changes but if I was to stop it from changing and leave it on what it is, I would never be able to host again because for some reason if my IP address starts with only two numbers I can’t host any type of server.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with hosting issue
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Your IP address changes or your IPv4 address changes? Davidi2 or someone made a tutorial on how to stop your IPv4 address from changing.

Read full topic
